page.title: 01Local History of Braunton.
page.content: Braunton is an{Anglo-Saxon settlement supposedly founded by{St.Brannock}in the ninth century.Braunton or "Brantona", is mentioned in the {Domesday book}as having been a manor in the name of the king.Today, it is an expanding village unique in being one of the few places to still have a large{open field,}one of only a few left in the country.It was a{thriving {port,}but nowadays it concentrates on attracting{new technology, and a large {tourist industry.}It has a {comprehensive school,several primaries and ample facillities, including a recently opened {shopping centre}and links to local towns.However,the local children have few{formal amusements. {Tourism}tends to inflate prices but, the{climate}is a compensation to local inhabitants.
